chief7575,"2022-01-21T14:11:49.143Z","Not so charming series of DOTS","

Picked up 5 packs of the newest line of DOTS, series 6 recently.
column2: I think this is the weakest entry into the line so far.&nbsp
column3: I have a 7 yr old daughter who loves these packs and the cool things you can get out of them.

column1: <li>Decorated faces/symbols/prints on the tiles, etc are fun, as usual.&nbsp
• New circle with the loop is interesting
• Charms are ok - but you are only given 2 different kinds, having so many repeats gets old real quick
• Charms can ONLY be used on the new loop part

column2: Managed to get all 16 prints, but only had 1 print of 3 of them.&nbsp

column1: <li>blue/pink/lavender half tiles and dots seem repetitive from earlier dots offerings.&nbsp
<li>Charms are REALLY difficult to connect to the loop.&nbsp
column2: My daughter was getting very frustrated by this and it was even difficult for myself to snap them on.&nbsp
column3: Plus, after you have a couple, who needs 10+ of each??&nbsp
column4: More variety of the charms would have been welcomed and a different color of the new circle w loop too .

column1: Overall - pretty MEH from me on this series.

This set has a number of really creative printed dots.
column2: The big news here is the new lightning and heart shaped charms, with the new plate with a loop on top, and trans-flourescent green quarter circles.&nbsp
column3: I can appreciate the Dots line for girls to make creative jewelry and decor, but the charms will probably not get used by me.&nbsp
column4: I think the new plate with a loop is going to be quite useful and I look forward to getting it in other colours in the future.

column1: I wish Lego put all of the printed dots in each bag but these are supposed to have an element of surprise to see which dots you got.
column3: t even show all of the printed dots available in the promotional pictures on the set page of their website.&nbsp
